name: v1.5.3 - Fix Docker UFW Bypass
body:
## Security Fix

Fixes Docker bypassing UFW firewall rules, allowing connections from any IP.

### The Problem
Docker manipulates iptables directly, bypassing UFW. Even with UFW rules restricting access to specific IPs, Docker containers were accessible from anywhere.

### The Fix
Adds `DOCKER-USER` chain integration to route container traffic through UFW's forward rules.

### Quick Fix for Existing Servers
Run this on affected servers:
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/profzeller/p16-server-setup/main/fix-docker-ufw.sh | sudo bash
```

### Verification
After running, `iptables -L DOCKER-USER -n -v` should show:
```
Chain DOCKER-USER
  target: ufw-user-forward
  target: RETURN
```

### Full Update
```
server-setup > Tools & Monitoring > Update server-setup
```
